results.definition: handle and cause to function
examples: control the lever

results.definition: exercise authoritative control or power over
examples: control the budget

results.definition: lessen the intensity of; temper; hold in restraint; hold or keep within limits
examples: control your anger

results.definition: a standard against which other conditions can be compared in a scientific experiment
examples: the control condition was inappropriate for the conclusions he wished to draw

results.definition: place under restrictions; limit access to by law
examples: this substance is controlled

results.definition: discipline in personal and social activities
examples: she never lost control of herself

results.definition: be careful or certain to do something; make certain of something
examples: control the quality of the product

results.definition: maintain influence over (others or oneself) skillfully, usually to one's advantage
examples: She is a very controlling mother and doesn't let her children grow up

results.definition: the state that exists when one person or group has power over another
check or regulate (a scientific experiment) by conducting a parallel experiment or comparing with another standard
examples: Are you controlling for the temperature?

results.definition: great skillfulness and knowledge of some subject or activity
a mechanism that controls the operation of a machine
examples: the speed controller on his turntable was not working properly
I turned the controls over to her

results.definition: have a firm understanding or knowledge of; be on top of
examples: Do you control these data?

results.definition: a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another
examples: measures for the control of disease
they instituted controls over drinking on campus

results.definition: a spiritual agency that is assumed to assist the medium during a seance
(physiology) regulation or maintenance of a function or action or reflex etc
examples: the timing and control of his movements were unimpaired
he had lost control of his sphincters

results.definition: power to direct or determine
examples: under control

results.definition: the activity of managing or exerting control over something
examples: the control of the mob by the police was admirable

results.definition: the economic policy of controlling or limiting or curbing prices or wages etc.
examples: they wanted to repeal all the legislation that imposed economic controls

results.definition: verify by using a duplicate register for comparison
examples: control an account
